About Me.name: Moyartu Manley
About Me.label: Undergraduate Research Assistant
About Me.summary: As a Computer Science major and Sociology minor, my interests are centered at the intersection of technology and human behavior. Thus, my work is driven by a fascination with how platform design shapes social interaction. Whether I am scraping imageboards to analyze community toxicity or winning a 'Fan Favorite' award at a game jam, I work to use technology to better understand and serve people.

work.name: Department of Computer Science, Macalester College
work.summary: Composed and presented research proposal to CS department faculty, securing approval for a novel study into online community dynamics. Analyzed the correlation between group demographics and community dynamics to identify key factors and directionality of toxicity in insular online spaces.
highlights: Developed and implemented a Python-based web scraper using Beautiful Soup 4 and Requests to efficiently collect and process posts from online imageboards.
Effectively communicated research findings and insights to faculty advisors through weekly meetings.

work.name: Department of Computer Science, Macalester College
work.summary: Utilized Atlas.ti for qualitative thematic analysis of datasets and engineered Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) models for topic discovery, uncovering 15 key thematic areas.
highlights: Contributed 80,000+ lines of code into an existing Python-based web scraper using Git.
Led the large-scale text tokenization of a 3.5+ million-word corpus, optimizing data preparation for NLP applications.
Presented key insights during bi-weekly principal investigator meetings, influencing project direction.

work.name: OptumRx
work.summary: Spearheaded the redesign of the OptumRx patient portal and developed a working prototype using Figma. Composed empathy maps based on detractors expressed by users.
highlights: Devised an implementation budget for the prototype and its associated services.
Presented project to the OptumRx team and industry leaders.

awards.summary: Won during the development of 'Discord In Your Heart'.

awards.title: Fan Favorite Award
awards.summary: Won during the development of 'Discord In Your Heart'.

projects.name: Mini SL Departure Display
projects.summary: Designed and deployed a full-stack embedded transit monitoring system using Node.js and Raspberry Pi, integrating the SL Public Transport API for live data.
highlights: Optimized data handling to manage and display best departure times across 8 nearest stations.
Used efficient state management to maintain a responsive display refresh rate.

projects.name: Discord In Your Heart
projects.summary: A game developed for a 48-hour game jam featuring a UI similar to Discord.
highlights: Implemented core gameplay mechanics, route options, and game endings.
Won 3 out of 4 awards at Macalester's 48-hour Cupid Jam.
